Thanks for the effort :)
I shared this channel to all my friends and they were mad at me for not introducing them earlier hehehe :face-blue-smiling:

If anyone is curious about his online class I highly recommend buying it. It's incredibly affordable, especially considering what you get. The outlines/quizzes/tests make all the difference in the world. I just finished my biology degree this fall after returning to college to teach K12. I last saw general chemistry around 2016 and decided I need to refresh it. It really feels like a legitimate college course and his explanations make me understand the material like never before. It's 100% worth it.
I cannot thank you enough! I stopped going to lecture and started watching your videos instead, and after I was bumped up an entire letter grade higher in gen chem LOL

I've been watching your gen chem playlist for a year now and I'm happy to report that I've gotten an A (and a perfect score on my final exam!). Seriously, these videos are amazing. I'm envious of the students who have had the privilege to have you as their professor because I'm sure that's the only next best thing! Happy holidays Chad, you've helped another student get one step closer to their dreams.
You are a real chad, Mr. Chad. Thanks for the video.

technically yes! If we go into this in further detail milk is a colloid with fat droplets interdispersed. I'm focussing on the difference between homogenous (uniform distribution of particles that does not separate on standing) versus heterogenous mixtures and therefore to the naked eye, milk appears homogenous. You're absolutely right though, on closer inspection milk is a colloid, but we don't go into it in so much detail in this video :)
Thanks

I'll be releasing approximately a chapters worth of videos per week until December when I'll take a couple weeks off for Christmas.  But then I'll start back up and should finish the course sometime in April.  So you might rely on my old General Chemistry Playlist for the end of the course.  And I do plan to reproduce my Physics playlist but not until next year at the earliest.  A new Biochemistry playlist is higher on my to-do list and is scheduled tentatively for next year with Physics coming after that.  Hope this helps!
